Really good game, very interesting but also quite challenging which is totally fine but can be frustrating. Good gameplay and graphics though ill admit i am stuck on it haha and a guide wont really help either. Must buy though for people who played and like games like siberia, broken sword etc xx

an amazing game, really fun if you enjoy a third person old school resident evil like look with a murder mystery twist it is definately enjoyable and you almost instantly fall in love with the female protaganist because of her quirks and dark humor.

I've played this game through several times over the years and still enjoy it. The game pulls off the link between the present and the past fluidly. The cut scenes were well done, even though at this point they are dated, they still draw you in. I think the only real flaw in the game is that sometimes you are left with no immediate purpose, and you wander from place to place until you find what you need to trigger the next step in the game. This is something that is present in most of the older point and click adventures, so I try not to let it keep me from enjoying the rest of the game.
If you're a fan of point and click adventure games or murder mysteries or especially both, you should certainly give this game a try.

After the disappointment of Post Mortem I was relieved to find this game is as great as I had been led to believe.   In comparison to Post Mortem, this game still has a hard coded 4:3 aspect screen resolution but crucially it does not crash all the time when the game loses focus. The horrible first person camera is gone. The annoying branching dialogue that could result in you ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ off a character so you miss out on crucial information has been replaced with a much simpler system. The interface is generally much better all round. There are no randomly appearing items in this game which makes things more satisfying as instead of back tracking across every location you can just remember where you saw a suitable item.  The story in this game is excellent, it really engaged me and kept me wanting to play on. The split between the two interconnected murder investigations was very well done.The puzzles are also very good, they are all very logical and don’t feel arbitrary. Most of them are quite simple but the more challenging ones take a bit of thinking about but are very satisfying.  I did encounter one bug though. The mouth movements didn’t work properly, the characters either kept their mouths closed or they rapidly flickered open and closed. This is only a very minor thing and in no way detracts from this excellent point and click adventure. I don’t think you are going to miss out on anything significant if you entirely skip Post Mortem and just start with this game.

A point&click game following a FBI agent, Victoria McPherson, investigation the murders of a deranged serial killer they are unable to catch. By chance, she finds out her grand-father, who was a private investigator, had encountered a similar case.  Not a very long game but quite enjoyable, with a great story and dialogues.

I think this is a great game challenging but real creative especially for being a point and click game. i originally completed on the originally xbox and want to play finish it again on this and get ont he next one i recommend if you want a creative game with a challenge of solving puzzles.

I liked the story but hated most of the puzzles. Eventually I had to check walkthrough for cookie baking puzzle for I have no nerve to fiddle with that nonsense. Especially when you have like gazillion permutations for right cooking recipe and each animations takes eternity. Oh joy when you fail. Also, I spent like 3h of gameplay solely solving the lockpicking puzzle: greatest time of my life. And that robot puzzle was also diamond, because it didn't indicate explicitly where's the goal (also because background graphics are so basic Microids: grey, dull and gray).

Still life is a detective murder mystery that builds good suspense with an intriguing twisted story that is enjoyable to follow and solve.   Still Life is a point-and-click adventure genre game; thus, a game more favorable to those who have ample patience for a slower paced game with a good amount of searching, exploring, and figuring out what to do next.   Still Life also includes puzzles mixed within the game, with some being very difficult to solve. Most people will need a walkthrough to solve the harder puzzles.   The graphics are not great, only having about average quality. Voice acting and dialogue range from fair to poor.   Score: 7 out of 10

From the producers of Syberia, Still life is a point & click adventure game that it's as exciting as the former. There are a lot of locations involved and the level design is amazing. As regards to the story, this is a well-thought game. There aren't a lot of plot twists and the resolution of the story might seem a little unsatisfying for some, but the overall plot has a lot of strong points. What I liked the most out of this topic is the interwined stories of Victoria and his grandfather, and how everything is not as black and white as one might think. The puzzles are very good, but at times a little cryptic, just like some parts of the game where you are left wondering what to do next. But, despite the minor flaws, Still life is a very exciting adventure and it has a lot to offer to people that enjoy a good story and well developed characters.

Pretty much exactly what you'd expect from a generic point-and-click adventure game, with all the out of place overcomplicated puzzles. To its credit, the game is refreshingly mature and has a couple of good jokes here and there. Unfortunately, it leaves a bad taste in your mouth because of its abrupt, unsatisfactory ending. 6/10

This is a pretty cool point-and-click horror crime thriller detective game with nice ambient background audio and a serial killer storyline. Worth checking out if you like a good detective game with a dark theme.
Morbid, with some ridiculous hard puzzles, but fun and interesting.
One of the most atmospheric adventure games ever created. Wanna feel like you are chasing an assassin a la 'Jack the Ripper'?   Yes? Then this is your game.
Great game, too bad so many people can't get it to work. Enjoy your $2.49, Steam.

Highly recomend this game. Graphic settings are old but does not spoil the game. Story line excellent and the puzzles although difficult in some cases are all solvable with the evidence given. Nice switch of characters between chapter 1 and 2 looking forward to completing and trying number two. 9/10   Now having to change my review as now come across a stupid puzzle that requires you to navigate a robot through a virtually invisible laser field. Totaly stupid and no way to bypass.  Destroyed about a thousand robots and still no luck.  A good adventure/puzzle game ruined by a stupid eye hand co-ordination puzzle.  5/10

This game is racist. The game's original dialog is in French. The translation to American English was not a responsible or subtle one. I made it to just past the opening credits when the first character the protagonist comes in contact with is an American black police officer. It appears that those responsible for the translation are only familiar with American black people through 19th century minstrel shows. As I can only find one review that discusses this atrocious characterization, and they only refer to it as 'borderline racist,' I feel some responsibility to inform the Steam community (a community that I consider mostly comprised of responsible and open-minded game consumers) to think twice before purchasing something so offensive. This racism is not borderline, it's outright and unacceptable.
All round good point and click adventure.
great point & click!

Point and click adventure at its best with a little gore and horror mixed in for a bloody tasty cake . Good story gets you ingrossed and really pulls you in. A couple of the puzzles suck like making a cake boooooring but apart from that i recommend this game in a nut shell its a jack the ripper type puzzle adventure with a little gore and horror 8/10

As adventure games go, this is not that great. I found the puzzles either too hard or too easy. There was a little too much pixel hunting for my liking and too many puzzles of the sort where to have to turn the right combination of knobs the right number of times.  However, I really enjoyed the story. I ended up playing it more as an interactive novel, using a guide to cheat my way through it, and that was an enjoyable experience for me - one I'd recommend to others.
Some of the puzzles are mind numbing, taking some of the fun out of the game. Has some great humor. Overall it's a great story. I recommend it but not as highly as I usually would. 4/5 stars

The story line behind this game was interesting and took a surprising turn a few times. It kept me hooked all the way up until the end and even after all that let me just tell you now you will be very surprised how much you get into this game without even knowing it. I will save you all the trouble and tell you now just buy number two because by the time you finish this one you will need to play the next one just to see what happens next I just hope I get an end to this story the next game.

If you like mysteries, rpgs, and horror games, I'm sure you'll love it. It was originally on xbox (not 360, just xbox) so the graphics are a little dated, but it's worth the time put into the game. :D
